title: Liverpool have proved they can be champions with Man Utd draw, claims Martin Keown
text:
Keown knows a thing or two about winning the Premier League title (Picture: Getty)

Martin Keown reckons Liverpool showed they can win the Premier League for the first time in their 1-1 draw with Manchester United.

Marcus Rashford gave United a first-half lead at Old Trafford but substitute Adam Lallana snuck in at the back post with five minutes remaining to level the scores.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain and Rashford both nearly won the game for their respective sides but a draw seemed like a fair result and the points were shared.

It brought Liverpool’s winning run to an end but they remain unbeaten in the Premier League since January and Arsenal legend Keown believes the dynamism they displayed is a sign they can break their league title drought.

Lallana scored a late goal to earn Liverpool a point (Picture: Getty)

‘We have to credit Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s Manchester United,’ Keown told The Daily Mail.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Their tactics confused and surprised the visitors.

‘Solskjaer used three at the back and his wing-backs played high.

‘United’s set-up meant they could apply good pressure on the ball all over the pitch.

‘But Liverpool got something out of this game. That suggests they can become champions.’

United were forced into a late change after Axel Tuanzebe was injured during the warm-up but it did not deter Solskjaer from a 3-4-1-2 set-up which caught many off guard, including Liverpool.

Jurgen Klopp was forced into a tactical change of his own in the second half but admitted afterwards that it was not the first time Liverpool had struggled to play their best football at Old Trafford.

And while Keown still thinks their claiming a point despite a poor performance was important, he believes their sub-par was down to mentality rather than tactics.

Solskjaer and Klopp ended up in a tactical battle on the touchline (Picture: Getty)

‘Liverpool need to learn to enjoy the situation they are in,’ Keown added.

‘Yes, every man and his dog may be prematurely putting a crown on your heads, but you have to embrace that. They lacked that mentality yesterday.

‘They did not turn up at Old Trafford looking like a team that had won their last 17 Premier League games.

‘They didn’t swagger in there like champions in waiting.’
description: Martin Keown reckons Liverpool showed they can win the Premier League for the first time in their draw with Manchester United yesterday.
